title.narrative: OUTPUT3.1.1 PEACE-BUILDING&RECONCILTION.

description.narrative: Output 3.1.1 by end 2016, national and local authorities in targeted areas, as well as alliances for children, involving the private sector, CSOs and the media facilitate a secure enabling environment for the active engagement and participation of adolescents and youth in activities promoting social cohesion, peace building and reconciliation, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3.1 by 2016, an alliance consisting of government, NGOs and communities, contribute to the increased and sustainable civic engagement of and partnerships for Child Rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1.1 by end 2016, national and local authorities in targeted areas, as well as alliances for children, involving theprivate sector, CSOs and the media facilitate a secure enabling environment for the active engagement and participation ofadolescents and youth in activities promoting social cohesion, peace building and reconciliation

description.narrative: National Youth Pogram 2017-2022 has been approved by the Government. UNICEF supported SMS based survey tool is gaining impetus with over 5100 subscribers and 25 surveys conducted on key dimensions of child and youth well-being. The surveys covered themes like climate change, school bullying, cyber-security, local governance healthy lifestyles etc | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/09/2017

title.narrative: of media institutions promoting peace building and child friendly policies and practices

target.value: 2016:One in the north and one in the south

actual.value: 2014:No progress. Funds missing. A new project proposal to PRF is under development.

title.narrative: of municipalities where young people lead community development and peacebuilding initiatives

actual.value: 2017:Two Independent Evaluations of the UNICEF peacebuilding interventions covering at least 14 municipalities recognize youth's important role

title.narrative: of communities where governments and civil society deliver youth and adolescent work with the focus on disadvantaged

actual.value: 2017:Youth work was delivered in at least 18 municipalities. Youth work was introduced in to curricula of 3 higher education institutions for advancing qualifications of municipality workers

title.narrative: % of youth centers fully funded (running and maintanance cost) by national and local level resources for running and maintaining

target.value: 2017:50% of existing youth cneters fully funded (from national and local resources)

title.narrative: of national and/or local digital and community media programs engaging children, youth and families to express their voices and aspirations

actual.value: 2014:On track. Two media companies were contracted to produce a documentary and a talk show based on the activities of the youth forum theatres in 15 communities in the southern provinces. All field work has been finished and the assembling of the films are currently in progress. A documentary on forum t

title.narrative: % of youth centers providing income generation skills to out-of-school young men and most disadvantaged adolescents and youth in line with needs expressed by the local labor market

baseline.value: Basic computer and language skills training provided in 17 youth centers

target.value: 2017:100% of youth centers provide increased livelihood opportunities

actual.value: 2017:All of the 30% youth centers funded through public funds provide computer and language literacy as well as skills building for employability and civic engagement
